text: Daniel T. Cronin (April 1, 1857 – November 30, 1885) was a 19th-century professional baseball outfielder and second baseman. He played in two games for two different teams in the Union Association in July 1884. He had previously played in the Eastern Championship Association and the Interstate Association."Dan Cronin Minor League Statistics & History". baseball- reference.com. Retrieved 2010-11-14. Cronin died in 1885, at the age of 28. ==References== ==External links== Category:1857 births Category:1885 deaths Category:Major League Baseball outfielders Category:Major League Baseball second basemen Category:St. Louis Maroons players Category:Chicago Browns/Pittsburgh Stogies players Category:Washington Nationals (minor league) players Category:Albany (minor league baseball) players Category:Trenton (minor league baseball) players Category:19th-century baseball players Category:Baseball players from Massachusetts
title: Dan Cronin (baseball)
